channel.title: Georg Makowski on Perplex Example
channel.description: Recent content in Georg Makowski on Perplex Example

item.title: Concept
item.description: A coherent site structure for different publishing formats, a typographic layout for enhanced Markdown content, and good legibility on all screen sizes are the essential goals of this theme.

item.title: Markdown Layout
item.description: Samples of Hugo’s extended CommonMark syntax to give a quick impression of the layout capabilities.

item.title: Features
item.description: A page layout based on classic typographical principles without compromise.

item.title: Coming Features
item.description: Features, which I consider essential, and the ones which would be nice to have.

item.title: Resources in Data Files
item.description: The theme offers a new possibility to store local parameters for resources. Data files allow to associate local meta-data with global or remote resources.

item.title: Search
item.description: The theme is now prepared for {=Pagefind}, a fast open-source full-text search engine for self-hosting.

item.title: Dark Mode
item.description: The theme offers a dark mode now. The colors follow the setting of the browser or operating system.

item.title: Second Pre-release{/}of the Perplex Theme
item.description: Author pages are now available and some layout elements have been improved.

item.title: First Pre-release{/}of the Perplex Theme
item.description: A new fluid-responsive Hugo theme is available for test runs.

item.title: Open files in VSCode{/}from Hugo’s server preview
item.description: Two short partials create a link to open the content file{/}of the current page in Hugo’s server mode.

item.title: Stand-alone Images
item.description: Demo for enhanced images and their layout possibilities.

item.title: Embedded images
item.description: Demo for the layout options of enhanced embedded images.

item.title: Hugo Module{/}for missing HTML inline tags
item.description: Replacement codes let us avoid raw HTML in Markdown.{/}A single partial replaces them with the inline tags{/}lacking a syntax element in Goldmark.

item.title: Code Block Layout Demo
item.description: On large screens, code blocks expand into the margins as long as possible and may include up to {$160} characters in one line.

item.title: Accessible fluid Design
item.description: Websites with a fluid-responsive design can be especially user-friendly and accessible. This site is an example.

item.title: The Beauty of Marginal Notes
item.description: Marginal notes add further information elegantly and unobtrusively. We can add them with the shortcode {$mnote}.
